channel.title: CVE Feed for ICS-CERT -- LCDS Laquis SCADA
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ICS-CERT -- LCDS Laquis SCADA

item.title: CVE-2018-18988|2024-08-05T11:23:08.508Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows execution of script code by opening a specially crafted report format file. This may allow remote code execution, data exfiltration, or cause a system crash.

item.title: CVE-2018-18996|2024-08-05T11:23:08.918Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows taking in user input without proper authorization or sanitation, which may allow an attacker to execute remote code on the server.

item.title: CVE-2018-18998|2024-08-05T11:23:08.679Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 uses hard coded credentials, which may allow an attacker unauthorized access to the system with high privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-18990|2024-08-05T11:23:08.494Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows a user-supplied path in file operations prior to proper validation. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose sensitive information under the context of the web server process.

item.title: CVE-2018-18992|2024-08-05T11:23:08.753Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows taking in user input without proper sanitation, which may allow an attacker to execute remote code on the server.

item.title: CVE-2018-19004|2024-08-05T11:23:08.522Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows out of bounds read when opening a specially crafted project file, which may allow data exfiltration.

item.title: CVE-2018-19000|2024-08-05T11:23:08.521Z -- ics-cert -- lcds%20laquis%20scada
item.description: LCDS Laquis SCADA prior to version 4.1.0.4150 allows an authentication bypass, which may allow an attacker access to sensitive data.
